question: India has partnered with which country recently to tackle chronic air pollution of Delhi?
explanation: Atmospheric scientists from the U.K. and India have partnered to tackle chronic air pollution, which is impacting the health of more than 20 million people in Delhi. Air pollution in Delhi is linked to a range of factors, including heavy traffic, burnt waste and dusty air in pre-monsoon season. The Indian capital, one of the countryâ€™s most densely populated cities, has some of the worst air pollutions of any city in the world.
